data.chText: 现存的；当前的
data.enText: existing or happening now

data.chText: 在当前形势下
data.enText: in the present situation

data.chText: 现在的房主
data.enText: the present owner of the house

data.chText: 过去和现在的全部会员名单
data.enText: a list of all club members, past and present

data.chText: 目前我们没有进一步的消息。
data.enText: We do not have any more information at the present time .

data.chText: 就当前而言，几句简短的话已经足够了。
data.enText: A few brief comments are sufficient for present purposes .

data.chText: 出现；在场；出席
data.enText: being in a particular place

data.chText: 有200人出席会议。
data.enText: There were 200 people present at the meeting.

data.chText: 存在

before.enText: of a thing or a substance

data.enText: existing in a particular place or thing

data.chText: 大气中的污染程度正在加深。
data.enText: Levels of pollution present in the atmosphere are increasing.

data.chText: 分析显示，尸体中有微量砒霜。
data.enText: Analysis showed that traces of arsenic were present in the body.
all present and correct
all present and accounted for

data.chText: 全到无误；应在场的都在场了
data.enText: used to say that all the things or people who should be there are now there
present company excepted

data.chText: 在座诸位除外；不关这里的各位
data.enText: used after being rude or critical about sb to say that the people you are talking to are not included in the criticism

data.chText: 礼物；礼品
data.enText: a thing that you give to sb as a gift

data.chText: 生日、圣诞节、结婚等礼物
data.enText: birthday/Christmas/wedding, etc. presents

data.chText: 我给他送点什么生日礼物呢？
data.enText: What can I get him for a birthday present?

data.chText: 目前；现在
data.enText: the time now

data.chText: 你必须忘掉过去，开始现在的生活。
data.enText: You've got to forget the past and start living in the present.

data.chText: 很抱歉他这会儿不在。
data.enText: I'm sorry he's out at present (= now) .
for the moment/present

data.chText: 目前；暂时
data.enText: for now; for a short time

data.chText: 这房子现在还够大。要是有了孩子，我们得搬。
data.enText: This house is big enough for the moment, but we'll have to move if we have children.
(there is) no time like the present

data.chText: 现在是做…的最佳时机；现在不做更待何时
data.enText: now is the best time to do sth, not in the future

data.chText: 给
data.enText: give

data.chText: 把…交给；颁发；授予
data.enText: to give sth to sb, especially formally at a ceremony

data.chText: 当地议员将鸣枪开赛，并颁发奖品。
data.enText: The local MP will start the race and present the prizes.

data.chText: 在他退休之际，同事们赠给他一套高尔夫球杆。
data.enText: On his retirement, colleagues presented him with a set of golf clubs.

data.chText: 这家人把宝剑捐赠给了博物馆。
data.enText: The sword was presented by the family to the museum.

data.chText: 考虑的事
data.enText: sth to be considered

data.chText: 提出；提交
data.enText: to show or offer sth for other people to look at or consider

data.chText: 委员会将于六月向议会提交最后的报告。
data.enText: The committee will present its final report to Parliament in June.

data.chText: 已提出八项备选方案供审议。
data.enText: Eight options were presented for consideration.

data.chText: 你要在大会上宣读论文吗？
data.enText: Are you presenting a paper at the conference?

data.chText: 方式
data.enText: sth in particular way

data.chText: （以某种方式）展现，显示，表现
data.enText: to show or describe sth/sb in a particular way

data.chText: 公司已决定，必须展现出更加现代的形象。
data.enText: The company has decided it must present a more modern image.

data.chText: 至关重要的是我们要表现得团结一致。
data.enText: It is essential that we present a united front (= show that we all agree) .

data.chText: 你需要更善于展示自己。
data.enText: You need to present yourself better.

data.chText: 他喜欢表现出一副激进政治家的样子。
data.enText: He likes to present himself as a radical politician.

data.chText: 文章把这些提案评为误导的产物。
data.enText: The article presents these proposals as misguided.

data.chText: 麻烦
data.enText: sb with problem

data.chText: 使发生；使经历
data.enText: to cause sth to happen or be experienced

data.chText: 你的请求应该不会给我们造成任何问题。
data.enText: Your request shouldn't present us with any problems.

data.chText: 使用这些化学品可能有失火的危险。
data.enText: Use of these chemicals may present a fire risk.

data.chText: 本身
data.enText: itself

data.chText: 突然出现；显露；产生

before.enText: of an opportunity, a solution, etc.

data.enText: to suddenly happen or become available

data.chText: 不过，确实出现了一个重大问题。
data.enText: One major problem did present itself, though.

data.chText: 一有机会，她就会另谋新职 。
data.enText: As soon as the opportunity presented itself, she would get another job.

data.chText: 谢天谢地，他意外地很快就找到了答案。
data.enText: Thankfully, a solution presented itself to him surprisingly soon.

data.chText: 广播 / 电视节目
data.enText: radio/TV programme

data.chText: 主持播放；主持（节目）
data.enText: to appear in a radio or television programme and introduce the different items in it

data.chText: 她曾在电视上主持一个园艺节目。
data.enText: She used to present a gardening programme on TV.

data.chText: 戏剧；广播
data.enText: play/broadcast

data.chText: 上演；公演；推出
data.enText: to produce a show, play, broadcast, etc. for the public

data.chText: 罗经剧团推出了全新制作的《李尔王》。
data.enText: Compass Theatre Company presents a new production of ‘King Lear’.

data.chText: 介绍
data.enText: introduce sb

data.chText: 正式介绍；引见
data.enText: to introduce sb formally, especially to sb of higher rank or status

data.chText: 请允许我向您介绍我的未婚夫。
data.enText: May I present my fiancé to you?

data.chText: 自己
data.enText: yourself

data.chText: 正式出席；莅临；出现
data.enText: to officially appear somewhere

data.chText: 将请你到场面试。
data.enText: You will be asked to present yourself for interview.

data.chText: 她被传唤于5月20日出庭。
data.enText: She was ordered to present herself in court on 20 May.

data.chText: 表达
data.enText: express sth

data.chText: （口头或书面）表达，表示
data.enText: to offer or express sth in speech or writing

data.chText: 请允许我致歉。
data.enText: Please allow me to present my apologies.

data.chText: 支票；账单
data.enText: cheque/bill

data.chText: 交付；提交
data.enText: to give sb a cheque or bill that they should pay

data.chText: 银行退回了杰克逊先生提交的支票。
data.enText: A cheque presented by Mr Jackson was returned by the bank.

data.chText: 承建商送来了一份数百英镑的账单。
data.enText: The builders presented a bill for several hundred pounds.
present arms

data.chText: 持枪敬礼
data.enText: to hold a rifle vertical in front of the body as a mark of respect

data.chText: actual与current或present意义不同，其含义为真实的或确实的，常与不真实或不确实的事物形成对比：
data.enText: Actual does not mean current or present . It means ‘real’ or ‘exact’, and is often used in contrast with something that is not seen as real or exact.

data.chText: 我需要确切的数字，而不是估计。
data.enText: I need the actual figures, not an estimate.

data.chText: present意为现存、现行：
data.enText: Present means ‘existing or happening now ’

data.chText: 你干现在这工作多长时间了？
data.enText: How long have you been in your present job?

data.chText: current也指现存、现行，但含暂时之意：
data.enText: Current also means ‘existing or happening now’, but can suggest that the situation is temporary.

data.chText: 这家工厂不能维持目前的生产水平。
data.enText: The factory cannot continue its current level of production.

data.chText: actually无现在、目前之意，表示此义用currently、at present或at the moment。
data.enText: Actually does not mean ‘at the present time’. Use currently , at present or at the moment instead.

ex.chText: 该国现有的石油储备到下世纪末可能用完。
ex.enText: The present oil reserves of the country might be used up by the end of the next century.

ex.chText: 目前黄金市场的形势使许多经济学家迷惑不解。
ex.enText: The present situation of the gold market has puzzled many economists.

synonyms.bx: 指现在存在或发生的，只作定语。

ex.chText: 我们通过无线电或电视了解时事。
ex.enText: We learn about current events through the radio or TV.

ex.chText: 这是现在流行的夹克款式。
ex.enText: This is the current fashion in jackets.

synonyms.bx: 指现时发生的或当今时代的，只作定语。

ex.chText: 她对科学领域的最新发展有极大的兴趣。
ex.enText: She has great interest in recent developments in science.

ex.chText: 在最近去美国的一次旅行中，他结交了几位有共同爱好的朋友。
ex.enText: He has made several friends who share the same hobby during his recent visit to America.

synonyms.bx: 指新近发生或刚刚开始的。

ex.chText: 这是我生日礼物中的一件。
ex.enText: This is one of my birthday gifts.

ex.chText: 画家把他最好的一幅油画赠送给了博物馆。
ex.enText: The painter sent his best painting, as a gift, to the museum.

synonyms.bx: 比 present 略正式，指为表示感谢或因喜爱某人而相送的礼物（如生日/节日礼物等），也可指捐赠的物品等。

ex.chText: 他给孩子们寄去了圣诞礼物。
ex.enText: He sent his Christmas presents/gifts to his children.

ex.chText: 他用它给我制作了一件礼品。
ex.enText: He made me a present/gift of it.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指为表示感谢、喜爱等送给某人的礼物，一般不很昂贵，常可与 gift 换用。

ex.chText: 我想给我夫人买些礼品。
ex.enText: I'd like to buy some souvenirs for my wife.

ex.chText: 请接受这个象征我们友谊的纪念物。
ex.enText: Please accept this as a small souvenir of our friendship.

synonyms.bx: 指度假时买回来送人的礼物，或指对某事物、某游览之地有纪念意义的物品。

ex.chText: 他把作文交给了老师。
ex.enText: He handed his composition to the teacher.

ex.chText: 这张表格必须交给所有员工。
ex.enText: This form must be handed to all the staff members.

synonyms.bx: 指将某物亲手交给他人。

ex.chText: 请把报纸递给我。
ex.enText: Pass me the paper, please.

ex.chText: 她把一杯咖啡递给经理。
ex.enText: She passed a cup of coffee to the manager.

ex.chText: 把球传给他。
ex.enText: Pass him the ball.

synonyms.bx: 指把某人可以看到但够不到的东西给某人。

ex.chText: 向委员会提交了大约40篇论文。
ex.enText: Some 40 papers were presented to the committee.

ex.chText: 大使向总统递交了国书。
ex.enText: The ambassador presented his credentials to the president.

synonyms.bx: 指将某物呈递给某人、某一机构等，通常用于正式场合。

ex.chText: 草案已经呈递给总统。
ex.enText: The draft was submitted to the president.

ex.chText: 我们应该向理事会提交计划以求批准。
ex.enText: We should submit our plan to the council for approval.

ex.chText: 我们还是把争执提交仲裁吧。
ex.enText: Let's submit our disputes for arbitration.

synonyms.bx: 指把计划等呈交给上级或权威人士审批或审查。

data.enText: all present and correct
all present and accounted for

data.chText: 全到无误；应在场的都在场了
data.enText: used to say that all the things or people who should be there are now there
present company excepted

data.chText: 在座诸位除外；不关这里的各位
data.enText: used after being rude or critical about sb to say that the people you are talking to are not included in the criticism
for the moment/present

data.chText: 目前；暂时
data.enText: for now; for a short time

data.chText: 这房子现在还够大。要是有了孩子，我们得搬。
data.enText: This house is big enough for the moment, but we'll have to move if we have children.
(there is) no time like the present

data.chText: 现在是做…的最佳时机；现在不做更待何时
data.enText: now is the best time to do sth, not in the future
present arms

data.chText: 持枪敬礼
data.enText: to hold a rifle vertical in front of the body as a mark of respect

tr: a verb tense that expresses actions or states at the time of speaking
something presented as a gift
example: his tie was a present from his wife

tr: the period of time that is happening now
any continuous stretch of time including the moment of speech
example: that is enough for the present
he lives in the present with no thought of tomorrow

tr: bring forward and present to the mind
example: We presented the arguments to him
We cannot represent this knowledge to our formal reason

tr: recognize with a gesture prescribed by a military regulation
assume a prescribed position
example: When the officers show up, the soldiers have to salute

tr: cause to come to know personally
example: permit me to acquaint you with my son
introduce the new neighbors to the community

tr: formally present a debutante, a representative of a country, etc.
deliver (a speech, oration, or idea)
example: The commencement speaker presented a forceful speech that impressed the students

tr: present somebody with something, usually to accuse or criticize
example: We confronted him with the evidence
He was faced with all the evidence and could no longer deny his actions
An enormous dilemma faces us

tr: represent abstractly, for example in a painting, drawing, or sculpture
example: The father is portrayed as a good-looking man in this painting

tr: perform (a play), especially on a stage
example: we are going to stage `Othello'

tr: give an exhibition of to an interested audience
example: She shows her dogs frequently
We will demo the new software in Washington

tr: give as a present
make a gift of
example: What will you give her for her birthday?

tr: give, especially as an honor or reward
example: bestow honors and prizes at graduation

tr: hand over formally
introduce
example: This poses an interesting question

tr: being or existing in a specified place
example: the murderer is present in this room
present at the wedding
present at the creation

value.def: You use present to describe things and people that exist now, rather than those that existed in the past or those that may exist in the future.

example.ex: He has brought much of the present crisis on himself...
example.tran: 目前的大部分危机都是他自己引起的。

example.ex: ...the government's present economic difficulties...
example.tran: 政府当前的经济难题

example.ex: It has been skilfully renovated by the present owners...
example.tran: 现在的主人非常巧妙地将其翻修了。

example.ex: No statement can be made at the present time.
example.tran: 目前不能发表任何声明。

value.def: The present is the period of time that we are in now and the things that are happening now.

example.ex: ...his struggle to reconcile the past with the present.
example.tran: 他为协调过去和现在所付出的努力。

example.ex: ...continuing right up to the present...
example.tran: 一直持续到现在

example.ex: Then her thoughts would switch to the present.
example.tran: 然后，她的思绪会转到现在。

value.def: In grammar, the present tenses of a verb are the ones that are used to talk about things that happen regularly or situations that exist at this time. The simple present tense uses the base form or the 's' form of a verb, as in 'I play tennis twice a week' and 'He works in a bank'.
A situation that exists at present exists now, although it may change.

example.ex: There is no way at present of predicting which individuals will develop the disease...
example.tran: 目前还没有办法预测谁会得这种病。

example.ex: At present children under 14 are not permitted in bars.
example.tran: 目前，14岁以下儿童不允许进酒吧。

value.def: The present day is the period of history that we are in now.

example.ex: ...Western  European art from the period of Giotto to the present day.
example.tran: 从乔托时期直至现代的西欧艺术

example.ex: ...monastic music of the present day.
example.tran: 当代的寺庙音乐

value.def: Something that exists or will be done for the present exists now or will continue for a while, although the situation may change later.

example.ex: The ministers had expressed the unanimous view that sanctions should remain in place for the present.
example.tran: 大臣们一致认为暂时还不能取消制裁。

value.def: If you say 'There's no time like the present', you are suggesting to someone that they should do something now, not later.

example.ex: Don't wait until New Year to resolve to organise your life. There's no time like the present.
example.tran: 不要等到新年才下决心规划生活。要把握当下。

value.tran: 机不可失，失不再来；就在当下

value.def: If someone is present at an event, they are there.

example.ex: The president was not present at the meeting...
example.tran: 总裁没有出席这次会议。

example.ex: Nearly 85 per cent of men are present at the birth of their children...
example.tran: 将近85%的男性在他们的孩子出生时都在场。

example.ex: The whole family was present.
example.tran: 全家人都到场了。

value.def: If something, especially a substance or disease, is present in something else, it exists within that thing.

example.ex: This special form of vitamin D is naturally present in breast milk...
example.tran: 这种特殊形态的维生素D天然存在于母乳中。

example.ex: One theory is that the infection has been present in humans for a very long time...
example.tran: 有一种理论认为，这种传染病存在于人类中已经有很长时间了。

example.ex: If the gene is present, a human embryo will go on to develop as a male.
example.tran: 如果这种基因存在，人类胚胎就会发育为男性。

value.tran: （尤指物质、疾病）存在于…的，包含于…的

value.def: A present is something that you give to someone, for example at Christmas or when you visit them.

example.ex: The carpet was a wedding present from the Prime Minister...
example.tran: 这张地毯是首相送的结婚礼物。

example.ex: I bought a birthday present for my mother...
example.tran: 我给母亲买了一份生日礼物。

example.ex: This book would make a great Christmas present.
example.tran: 这本书会是一份很不错的圣诞礼物。

value.def: If you present someone with something such as a prize or document, or if you present it to them, you formally give it to them.

example.ex: The mayor presented him with a gold medal at an official city reception...
example.tran: 市长在一次正式的市政招待会上给他颁发了一枚金质奖章。

example.ex: Prince Michael of Kent presented the prizes...
example.tran: 肯特亲王迈克尔颁发了奖品。

example.ex: The group intended to present this petition to the parliament.
example.tran: 这个团体打算把这份请愿书呈递给议会。

example.ex: Then came the presentation of the awards by the Queen Mother.
example.tran: 然后由王太后颁奖。

value.def: If something presents a difficulty, challenge, or opportunity, it causes it or provides it.

example.ex: This presents a problem for many financial consumers...
example.tran: 这给很多金融消费者带来了一个问题。

example.ex: The future is going to be one that presents many challenges...
example.tran: 未来将会面临诸多挑战。

example.ex: This summer school presents an opportunity to experience all aspects of dance...
example.tran: 今年夏天，学校提供了一次全方位体验舞蹈的机会。

example.ex: Public policy on the family presents liberals with a dilemma.
example.tran: 有关家庭的公共政策使自由主义者陷入了进退两难的境地。

value.def: If an opportunity or problem presents itself, it occurs, often when you do not expect it.

example.ex: Their colleagues insulted them whenever the opportunity presented itself...
example.tran: 一有机会，同事们就会侮辱他们。

example.ex: A further obstacle has presented itself, however.
example.tran: 然而，突然又出现了一个障碍。

value.def: When you present information, you give it to people in a formal way.

example.ex: We spend the time collating and presenting the information in a variety of chart forms...
example.tran: 我们花费时间用各种各样的图表来比照和展示这些信息。

example.ex: We presented three options to the unions for discussion...
example.tran: 我们向工会提供了3种选择供讨论。

example.ex: In effect, Parsons presents us with a beguilingly simple outline of social evolution.
example.tran: 事实上，帕森斯向我们展示了一个看似简单的社会沿革轮廓图。

example.ex: ...in his first presentation of the theory to the Berlin Academy.
example.tran: 当他第一次向柏林学院陈述该理论的时候

example.ex: ...a fair presentation of the facts to a jury...
example.tran: 向陪审团就事实所作的公正陈述

example.ex: No amount of slick presentation can disguise the gap between what the government promised and what it has delivered.
example.tran: 无论多少漂亮的说辞都掩盖不了政府的承诺和其实际的兑现之间的差距。

value.def: If you present someone or something in a particular way, you describe them in that way.

example.ex: The government has presented these changes as major reforms...
example.tran: 政府将这些变化描述为重大的改革。

example.ex: The British like to present themselves as a nation of dog-lovers...
example.tran: 英国人喜欢把自己说成是一个爱狗的民族。

example.ex: In Europe, Aga Khan III presented himself in a completely different light.
example.tran: 在欧洲，阿迦汗三世表现得完全是另一副样子。

value.def: The way you present yourself is the way you speak and act when meeting new people.

example.ex: ...all those tricks which would help him to present himself in a more confident way in public.
example.tran: 能使他在公众面前表现得更为自信的那些窍门

value.def: If someone or something presents a particular appearance or image, that is how they appear or try to appear.

example.ex: The small group of onlookers presented a pathetic sight...
example.tran: 这一小群旁观者看上去让人觉得悲哀。

example.ex: In presenting a more professional image the party risks losing its individuality.
example.tran: 为了给人一种更为职业的形象，该党可能会丧失自身特色。

example.ex: ...presenting a calm and dignified face to the world at large.
example.tran: 向全世界展示出一副冷静和威严的面孔

value.def: If you present yourself somewhere, you officially arrive there, for example for an appointment.

example.ex: She was told to present herself at the Town Hall at 11.30 for the induction ceremony...
example.tran: 她被告知于11点30分在市政厅参加就职仪式。

example.ex: We presented ourselves to the authorities promptly.
example.tran: 我们立即向当局备案。

value.def: If someone presents a programme on television or radio, they introduce each item in it.

example.ex: She presents a monthly magazine programme on the BBC.
example.tran: 她在英国广播公司主持一个月刊节目。

value.boxr_value: in AM, usually use 美国英语通常用 host, introduce

value.def: When someone presents something such as a production of a play or an exhibition, they organize it.

example.ex: The Lyric Theatre is presenting a new production of 'Over the Bridge'.
example.tran: 利里克剧院正在上演新排的《桥对面》。

value.def: If you present someone to someone else, often an important person, you formally introduce them.

example.ex: Fox stepped forward, welcomed him in Malay, and presented him to Jack...
example.tran: 福克斯走向前，用马来语向他表示欢迎，并把他介绍给了杰克。

example.ex: Allow me to present my wife's cousin, Mr Zachary Colenso.
example.tran: 请允许我介绍我妻子的表哥，扎卡里·科伦索先生。

trans: 现状；状况；目前现状；目前状况；条件
目前地位；现状；目前状态；身份
举枪对准某人瞄准，用(武器)对准某人
现在；目前；固定词组；在目前
生日礼物；寿礼；生日礼品；物轻情重
古今；过去与现在；今昔；过去和现在；過去與現在
顺应当前形势，只顾眼前
